question_text: Why might a high-performance docking station use proprietary connectors instead of standard USB-C?
answer_options: To reduce the risk of malware infections
To provide additional bandwidth for video and data
To allow simultaneous charging and BIOS access
correct_answer: To provide additional bandwidth for video and data
explanation: Proprietary docks often provide higher bandwidth than generic USB-C, enabling support for multiple monitors and fast data transfer.
